dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I think I am going to take off.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You should stay and smoke with me.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I promise you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: My Dad’s birthday party is tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Isn't that in like eight hours? Zeke pulls a bong out of the closet. ZEKE (CONT’D) Let’s celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Oh my god what time is it?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Like 5 something.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Shit, I have to go. INT. MONROE’S CAR - LATER DANGER ZONE is still blasting in the backround. Mo is at wheel swerving through traffic like a madman. He can hear cars honking all around him. EXT. MONROE’S CAR - SAME TIME Mo is actually driving five miles an hour and several car behind him are honking, trying to pass. INT. MONROE’S SHOWER - LATER Monroe is in the shower, somehow trying to wash his eyes. sits down in the shower and takes a quick nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He psyches himsef up the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: You are fine. You are totally natural. You aren’t stoned. People smoke weed all the time and nobody ever notices. You are so fine.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents sit at the table talking.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Standing outside the kitchen still trying to psyche himse up. He listens to them talking. They start to laugh at a joke can’t hear. On that he walks in laughing as well, he thin this will blend him in but he just looks like a crazy per

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What? I mean excuse me? He sits down at the table, still trying to appear normal.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are we going to this thing?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Oh no. Reuben what’s wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I think I know. Monroe can hear them talking but can’t bring his mouth to rebuttal. So he just continues to act as if nothing is happening.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I totally forgot, Happy Birthday! He gets up and give’s his father a hug.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know this is a nightmare. (to Mo) How could you do this on my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Do what?  65.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea how much trouble you are in?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Let’s just go we are going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Should we leave him at home?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know how to explain to my parents that Mo got too stoned.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Guys, you are wrong.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Everything. All of it.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parents sit up front. Reuben drives. Mo is in the backseat, trapped in his own mind.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: This is exactly what I’m talking about. Ten seconds of stupid.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I think it’s been a misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Please stop talking Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Listen, when we go inside. You kiss your grandparents hello. You say nothing else. Are you listening to me?  66. MO’s POV - His parents are moving in slow motion and soun like the teacher from Charlie Brown. The car pulls up to Mo’s grandparents house. His parents each other one last look.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Please don’t eat too much.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Oh shit, you're right. (to Mo) Don’t even go near the buffet. Just say hi and go sit down somewhere, I will give you food.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The three of them walk to the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: We good?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: We're great!

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: You are a real idiot. The door opens. It’s Mo’s grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
dialogues.text: Hello! Come on in. Take off your coats. The family takes off their jackets. GRANDMOTHER (CONT’D) Hi Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What- Hi.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
dialogues.text: How’s school going?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (long pause) A lot.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFET
dialogues.text: Mo walks past, eyeing the mini hot dogs.  67.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: (sotto) Don’t even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE
dialogues.text: Mo sits at the table not saying anything. Kate and Doug a on either side of him. The three of them whisper to each other.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How high are you right now?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Nobody can hear me.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: How obvious is it?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Nobody can tell, you are doing great.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Do Mom and Dad know?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. I don’t think so. Across the table Reuben glares at his son.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Grounded?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Big time.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You will never guess what I am doing right now.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What?  68.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I'm shaving. Reveal Zeke is in his bathroom shaving, he has a bluetoot phone in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I got one of those bluetooth things. I am fucking shaving and talking to you at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m in a lot of trouble man, will you just focus.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Are you allowed to go to school?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Yes Isaac, my parents are not banning me from going to school.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: That’s good I guess. You are still going to that party tomorrow night right?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Are you listening to me at all.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Mo, you gotta go. Nick already got everything.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Sneak out. You have to Momo. You’11l be fine.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Monroe? Reveal Sherri in the kitchen on the other phone line.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Who are you talking to?  69.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Zeke.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Hi Isaac. I am guessing Monroe told you he is in a bit of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yes he mentioned that.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: I just don’t understand where these kids are getting the drugs.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? The kids at his school, it’s everywhere. I bet they are selling it right there on the playground at recess.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m a junior in high school we don’t have recess or a playground.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Was this going on when you were in high school?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I had heard about certain kids doing it. And I was at one or two parties where it was offered to me, but it just seems so gross ya know? It’s like why do that to yourself? The human brain is a gift, we need to treat it like-

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Alright Rabbi, thank you for that I think she get’s it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: I wish some of that would rub off on your friend.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I’m trying. Oh hey Mrs. K, guess what I am doing right now?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: She doesn’t care.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I'm shaving.  70.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Bluetooth.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Alright, well good night Isaac. Mo, your shot is ready.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Okay I’m coming down. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I think they are going to let me adopt you.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You are going to the party. Mo hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monroe walks down the hall. He sees Sophie, she sees him, doesn’t say anything. She is confused but shakes it off. is very unsure of this plan. Epstein approaches.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: Yo baby. You coming tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I don’t know, might have to sit this one out.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: No no no. You can’t miss this.  71.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m grounded, dude. My hands are tied.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: Sneak out. Come after your parents go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Listen man, I said I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: I am begging you. Just then the two boys see Danny and Josh being escorted of the principals office.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What were Josh and Danny doing in Mr. Wool’s office.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Look, Danny and Josh were just talking to Mr. Wool.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know man. That could be anything.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Fuck this.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: You are being paranoid man.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: The school is on to us. I’ve got to sneak out of my house. I’m the only one taking a risk.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: We're all taking risks baby.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Don’t call me baby.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: You need to calm down Mo. Nobody knows anything. Mo hates having this conversation in school.  72.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Will you just keep it down.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: So we have a deal?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: The price is going up.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: I love you. I fucking love you. Oh by the way you think you could bring some ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What do I look like to you?

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN
dialogues.text: Is this a trick question? Mo just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: EPSTEIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ya know what. Forget about ecstasy. I have a huge exam tomorrow anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo's parents are in the kitchen drinking wine and talking

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: INSERT - TEXT FROM SOPHIE: “MO?” It kills him but he ignores it. Zeke better be right. Mo is in his room directly above them, moving around quie He puts on camouflage pants and a camouflage shirt. He go to the bathroom where he has laid out green and black fac paint. He paints his face. Mo moves to the window of his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: FROM OUTSIDE THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: We see Mo open the window and climb out onto the ledge of house. The second floor isn’t that high up, but Mo’s heig makes the drop seem much scarier. He grabs on to a nearby tree and tries his best to shimmy to the ground. Eventual he falls off and lands in some bushes. From the kitchen window his parents are oblivious to the whole thing.  73. Trying to stay under the view of the window, he crawls to end of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo walks into the house. The banner reads “GI JOES AND AR HOS”. Our hero blends in nicely in a sea of military fati (and camo underwear. ) Eppy is on his knees drinking from a beer bong, but the crowed surrounding him rushes over to greet Mo, leaving h alone on his knees holding the giant funnel to his mouth. Sophie sees Mo and waves. Ignoring her, he walks with a g of boys to the bathroom. INT. ZEKE’S APARTMENT Zeke is on his couch with a bowl of cereal. He is in his boxers and has the phone pinned between his shoulder and ear.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You have a pretty voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the phone bank girls, ALLISON.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Mr. Presanti, the bidding is up to six thousand.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Would you like to have dinner with me?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Mr. Presanti, if you want to just tell me your maximum bid, I will just bid to your max and you don’t need to sit on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You aren’t enjoying talking to me as much as I am.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I am in the middle of an auction.  74.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Can you go someplace quiet? She laughs. ZEKE (CONT’D) I am making you laugh. Do you have a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: This is really inappropriate.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Something tells me there aren’t any rules about flirting with prospective buyers. Something tells me it is recommended or they wouldn't have such pretty girls like yourself working the phones.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I don’t have a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Of course you don’t. I was recently broken up with.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Why did she break up with you? As Allison talks she makes silent handmotions to the auctioneer raising his bid at will.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (he turns to the other room) Why did you break up with me? Holly walks from the kitchen through the living room carr a bag of her stuff. She gives him the middle finger on he way out. ZEKE (CONT’D) I think it’s still a little raw. The auctioneer bangs the podium.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Congratulations, you are now the proud owner of an 8,000 dollar Fujikawa painting.  75.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Is it any good?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Meh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo comes out of the bathroom first. He looks around the p and then we track behind him to the front door like we al do, except before he can make his escape somebody blocks exit.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You have been a dick to me all week.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I know - I’m not, I--

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You didn’t seem like an asshole but maybe that’s your secret. You’re a secret asshole. She starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m not. It wasn’t my idea. I’m sorry. Zeke thought if I didn’t give you attention you would like me more.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You are an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I know. A big idiot. Huge one. Please. Give me another chance. I won’t mess it up. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go on a real date. None of this dress up bullshit. Let’s go out for real.  76.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You gonna take anymore advice from your friend?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: He’s dead to me I swear! INT. MO’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER With smeared face paint Mo drives home completely ecstati He sings DAVID BOWIE - YOUNG AMERICAN’S at the top of his lungs as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS AT THE PARTY DANCING AND MAKING OUT
dialogues.text: EXT. MO’S HOUSE - NIGHT Mo stands in front of his window trying to jump up and re the tree branch. He can’t do it. He gives it a running st but still no luck.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Oh fuck it. He walks in the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three obscured boys in army fatigues drive in a cloud of smoke and sing along with the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The principal sits at his desk with a uniformed police officer standing behind him. They talk to a man and woman  77.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: I just don’t want there to be any confusion between us. I don’t want you to think that your son is off the hook, because he is not. The only reason you are sitting here talking to us is because I ama practical person. I am not trying to clog a leak with my finger I am trying to build a dam. I am trying to rid this community of all the underage drinking and drugs that go on almost every night. Jonathan was behind the wheel of a car, not only drunk, but stoned on marijuana and cocaine. And like I said the only reason you are sitting here today is because I want to know who is responsible for selling these drugs to him and his friends. We pan from the distraught parents to reveal Epstein sitt in the corner of the office, holding back tears.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Principal Wool has been very generous in allowing to keep Jonathan enrolled in school on the basis of his cooperation. MONROE’S HOUSE - DAY His parents are sitting at the table. Reuben is reading t paper.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Monroe wants to go out.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: To a party? Not a chance-

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: On a date. Reuben is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: My Monroe? With who?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Sophie something.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: What does she look like?  78.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: No of course not, I was just- It’s your call, I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: I don’t like him driving after that car accident.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: So say no.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Well I don’t want to take this away from him-

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: So say yes, for christ sake what do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Maybe we can send him with somebody, have somebody else drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reuben answers the front door for Zeke.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Hi Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Mr. Kaufman.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four of them sit around the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: You understand Zeke this is a special privilege for Mo.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yes.  79.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: A group of boys in Monroe’s class got in a car accident, there were drugs AND alcohol in their system.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Do we really have to do this?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Will you go wait for Isaac in his car. Isaac throws him his car keys, Mo leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No drinking. No drugs.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Got it. But what about Mo?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: It was a joke.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Sherri is very worried about these kids drunk driving around.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I would never let anything happen to Mo.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Listen Isaac, I like you. And that Eddie Haskel shit works wonders on Sherri but not me. I work in advertising... so... (off Zeke’s unsure look) Mo looks up to you, he never had an older brother, and that’s how he’s always seen you.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I’m not your father. Just-just sometimes I think you and your friends forget he is sixteen.  80.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Reuben takes a twenty dollar bill out of his pocket and s it into Zeke’s hand. ZEKE (CONT’D) Mr. Kaufman, I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Please take it.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I like hanging out with Mo, it isn’t a job.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: That’s why I am giving you this. Because it is a job. If he starts smoking dope and drinking, you aren’t doing your job.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Well I think he’s a pretty good kid.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I do too.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: So can I have a raise?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Get out of my house. INT. ZEKE’S CAR - LATER The boys are driving to pick up Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Listen, do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Don’t be you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Who would you like me to be?  81.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m serious. Your shitty advice almost cost me this date. I just don’t want tonight to be the Zeke show.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: The Zeke show! ?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. You don’t always have to be the bride at every wedding and the corpse at every funeral.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: How long have you been waiting to use that one?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: A while.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You need to relax.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me to relax, I am very relaxed. Why? Do I not seem relaxed, fuck it. Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Do you not trust me?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Would you even be going on a date if it wasn’t for me?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I am going on this date in spite of you.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Would you have kissed her if it wasn’t for me?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What kind of credit are you looking for here? The car pulls up in front of Sophie’s house. Zeke honks t horn.  82.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t do that. I’ll go get her.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: No you won’t. Trust me, this is better. ZEKE (CONT’D) Here, take this. He pulls out a small pill from the pocket of his jean jac

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: It’s a Valium. It will chill you out. Make you much more appealing.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Actually?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Does it have any side effects?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: No, just don’t drink too much.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I wasn’t planning on drinking at all.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Then you’1ll be great. He takes the pill. Then looks to the house. POV - Sophie coming out. She looks great. Zeke opens the middle compartment and then back in his pocket. Then around as if he is searching for something.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Don’t freak out.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: About what?  83.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I think I just gave you an Ambien.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What? Sophie is almost at the car.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (he takes a pill out of the bottom of the cup holder) Because here is the valium and I only had one.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What kind of an operation are you running here?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: You gave me a sleeping pill, why would you even bring that?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: It was an accident. He looks out the window. Frantic.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: How long do I have?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Minutes?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Maybe twenty good ones. Sophie reaches her hand to open the back door.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Abort. Abort. Drive the car. Zeke starts to drive the car. Sophie is confused.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, stop. Fuck. The car stops. Sophie gets in.  84.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: (half laughing, half serious) What was that?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Zeke drives like a retard. Zeke shoots him a look. Then looks at Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Is this your idea of not involving Zeke in our relationship?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I didn’t want this either.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Hey, I’ve got feelings you two.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yeah Romeo, where are we going.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (scared to death) Something fast I think. Right?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: I have nowhere to be.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (starting to enjoy this) Me either.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I thought you had that thing in twenty minutes Zeke? That appointment?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: No I am severely unemployed thanks for reminding me.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s fine.  85.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: He’s just nervous I think. Would you relax? You guys have already kissed right? ZEKE (CONT’D) (to Sophie) He kissed you right?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Yes. Mo is mortified.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (to Mo) See dude you're fine, the hardest part is over. (to Sophie) How was he?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Oh for the love of god would you-

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: He was good.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Don’t sound so surprised buddy I bet you were great. Mo has a very pleased look on his face. ZEKE (CONT’D) Okay youngins, where is this love bus going?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (to Sophie) Whatever you want to do.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Never tell a girl you’1l do whatever she wants, pretty soon she is going to want to do your friends.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (sotto) Zeke show?  86.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Sorry, I’m just trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Ice cream?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Are you asking her or-

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Ice cream!

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: There it is.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: He really is your relationship coach.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: He’s more of a sociopath than a coach. She laughs. Zeke looks to Mo and gives him a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (mouths ) You're doing great.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (mouths ) Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit outside at a picnic table eating. Mo is holding consciousness for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Okay I’ve got one.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Alright go.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Would you rather every time you take a shower Gatorade comes out of the faucet Or-

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: That's gross. Can I shower in the sink?  87.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Hmm. No. You can drink water but any time it touches your body it is Gatorade. OR Everything you eat from now on will taste like pickles. No matter what the fuck it is, it tastes like pickles.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: I like pickles.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Every day for every meal for the rest of your life?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: It’s better than pouring sticky colored water all over myself. (to Mo) What would you do?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Which one is that bad guy?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Mo forces an out of place laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Sort of tastes like breakfast food even though you wouldn’t right or no? No. Zeke shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Hang in there buddy.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: You know what would go great with this ice cream? Pyramids.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Is he having a stroke.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: It’s not me fault. You’re pretty I like you you're pretty.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (Sotto to Mo) Stop fighting it, you’re making it worse.  88.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (shutting his eyes) I'm just closing for one minutes. Not even. Mo falls asleep, collapsing into his cup of Mint Chocolat Chip.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. INT. ZEKE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER Zeke and Sophie sit in the front. Monroe is asleep but propped up in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Well this is a strange situation

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Listen, don’t let this whole, Mo passing out thing turn you off. He really is a great guy. And this is probably like 10 percent my fault.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You guys are really running a great operation over here.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: That's what he said! See you two are perfect for each other. (then) Okay, let’s get you home.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT KATE KAUFMAN HOUSE
dialogues.text: Monroe's older sister answers the door. Zeke is holding M like a baby in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (as if nothing was wrong) Hey Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh my god what’s wrong with him.  89.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (annoyed at her lack of manners ) How about: Hi Zeke. Nice to see you. How are you? It’s been a long time. This is a nice surprise. You look great. Did you lose some weight? I can’t stop thinking about you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Does he need to go to the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (Stepping into the house) No, he took an Ambien. Accidentally. I let him out of my sight for one second and you know- (then) You've done a little redecorating since the last time we were here.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You drugged him? Is he going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You know I recently came into a small collection of art myself. A few Cutlers, a Fujikawa print. Mostly up and comers. You should come over some time and check it out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m calling my parents.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Please don’t. He’s fine I promise. He just needs to sleep this off. Can I put him down somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Put him on the couch. Zeke walks over to the couch and lays him down. He waits until Kate is looking in his direction and then kisses Mo the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (for her benefit) It’s going to be okay buddy.  90.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So what I just wait until he wakes up and then take him home?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I would really feel more comfortable waiting with him. Your parents aren’t expecting him home for a few hours, he’1ll be up by then. She looks at him, knowing full well what he’s doing. ZEKE (CONT’D) Your Dad gave me a big speech, there may have been a cash bribe. I don’t want him to think he can’t trust me with Mo’s safety.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (indicating her passed out brother) Yeah I don’t know why he would ever think that. Mo looks up to you. You have to take better care of him.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (defensive) I reuse those pill bottles over and over. It’s very hard to keep track. (He looks to Mo then turns back to Kate) Do you have any water or something?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s a good idea, do you think he’1l drink it.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I meant more for me. She rolls her eyes and walks into the other room. Zeke lo around at the house. ZEKE (CONT’D) So where’s what-his-face?

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (from the other room) You know his name.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Where is Doug?  gl.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Doug is at an opening.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: That sounds about right, what a prick. Why didn’t you go?

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I didn’t feel like getting dressed up. Zeke looks at his sleeping friend on the couch and then g up and goes to the kitchen. He comes up from behind and p his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You know if you were my girlfriend, you would never have to get dressed up for anything. She pretends not to like what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Of course not, we would just smoke pot and watch Top Gun every night until we starved to death. She turns around so they are face to face.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You aren’t a kid anymore. But he is. And you aren’t doing him any favors. Getting him stoned before my Dad’s birthday. Drugging him like this, and god knows what else.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (thinking about everything else) That's pretty much it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s obvious that he hangs out with you so he can feel cool. But one day he is going to wake up and realize you are just hanging out with him because you need to feel cool too, and he is the last person on earth who thinks you are. And then he won't. This lands hard with Zeke. He drops his head, this is the most vulnerable we’ve seen him.  92.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. That was maybe too far. He lifts his head and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pulling away) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I just thought-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: THAT is what you took away from what I just said? Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t say that. Even if it’s true don’t say it. He kisses her hard, this time she doesn’t pull away.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. ZEKE’S CAR - LATER Mo slowly wakes up and tries to get his bearings. He is sitting in the passenger seat. They are parked in front o Mo's house.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You did great tonight buddy.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I fell asleep. (waking up) You drugged me. (very awake) Oh god you son of a bitch what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: It’s fine. Everything is fine. Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me to relax. The last time you told me to relax I passed out in my Ice Cream. Oh fuck, I need to call her.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: No no man, it was cool. Like you didn’t give a shit. Like you couldn’t be bothered to stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: You really are a psycho. Mo get’s out of the car. Zeke sits in the car. Thinking about what Kate about this boy who’s life he continues to mess up the music and drives away. EXT. MO’S HOUSE - SAME TIME Before Mo can make it to the front door he get’ call.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Hello? - Right now? - Is everything okay? - I’m sort of - Nothing - Can it wait until tomorrow? Okay I’m on my way. Mo walks to his car and get’s in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rings the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: It’s me. The front door buzzes and he rushes in.
said. Thinking up. He turns s a phone Holly opens the front door, she is in a towel, fresh out the shower. She holds an empty drink in her hand and Mo c smell the whiskey coming out of her pores.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?  94.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: You made it seem like you were in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh stop being dramatic.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (still panting a little) Me? You literally said “come quick I’m in trouble.”

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You are hilarious. (Then) I’m going to go get dressed. Make us a refill.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Um-— He walks over to the bar she has set up in the corner of studio apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to be up really early tomorrow, I should probably-

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: So just because me and Zeke broke up you don’t want to be my friend anymore? That’s pretty lame.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: No it’s not that.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: One drink. I just want to catch up. He gives up. She puts on a record, something sexy.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Your apartment is very adult. He fumbles his way around the bar trying to remember how makes whiskey sours. When he finally finishes he brings the drinks into the ro where Holly is sitting at a white vanity next to her bed. is completely naked combing her hair. He can see her body reflected in the mirror. She smiles at him.  95.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gulping) I thought you just wanted to catch up? She puts on a turquoise silk robe and stands up to face h

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t want to-

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You are a really good guy. His voice cracks.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You are a lot better than your friend.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Well I- I don’t think it’s a competition. We both have our strengths-— She opens her robe.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -and weaknesses.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Have you ever thought about doing this with me?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Yes. She pushes him onto the bed. SFX - A crowd cheering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo walks up to the plate. Everybody in the stands are chearing for him, including Zeke, Tony and Nick. Mo clear has a pit in his stomach. The first ball flies by.

dialogues.speaker: UMP
dialogues.text: Strike.  96. He looks at Zeke who motions for him to get lower. Mo crouches down. The pitch...

dialogues.speaker: UMP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ball 1

dialogues.speaker: PITCHER
dialogues.text: He’s too short, I have nowhere to put the ball.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (yelling from the stands) Hey asshole I’1l show you where you can put the ball. The pitch...

dialogues.speaker: UMP
dialogues.text: Ball 2. Angle on the boys clapping. Angle on Mo looking at Zeke, feeling terrible.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I’m worried about Mo.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I think we are getting him in over his head. The pitch...

dialogues.speaker: UMP
dialogues.text: Ball 3.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: He’s loving it.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: He’s loving it because he thinks he’s impressing us.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So what do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I think he is just losing it a little. Those kids crashed the car, and the roofie date. I’m just worried-  97.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (Godfather impression) This is not the life I wanted for my boy. The pitch....

dialogues.speaker: UMP
dialogues.text: Ball 4. Take your base. Mo walks to first base.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (yelling from the stands) There you go baby. Just like that. Every time, every fucking time. (sitting down) Love that little shrimp. INT. MO’S ROOM - NIGHT It’s snowing outside. Mo is on the phone as he looks out window and sees Nick and Tony pull up outside the mailbox

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: They just got here. ZEKE’S APARTMENT Zeke is talking on his bluetooth while doing crunches.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Alright. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m good. Do I not seem good? I’m good. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Are you just nervous about seeing Sophie?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: No, no. I mean, yeah sort of.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Well don’t worry, it’s going to be great. I know she likes you. You already have it on lock.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: You think?  98.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You're going to do great.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Alright, I’1l talk to you after. Mo hangs up feeling like a big asshole.

dialogues.speaker: EXT./INT. HOUSE PARTY NIGHT
dialogues.text: We track behind Mo as he walks into the party. This is ea the biggest house we’ve seen yet. Snow covers the front y The banner in front reads “Christmas Bros and Ho Ho Hos” Unlike everybody else, Mo didn’t really feel like dressin like Santa.

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT
dialogues.text: He sees a girl he recognizes.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Hey do you know if Sophie is here?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: No she’s not here or no you don’t know? The girl is gone before he can finish his sentence. INT. ZEKE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Zeke is playing video games and eating cereal in his underwear. There is a knock at the door. He get’s up to answer it. It’s Holly, she has been crying

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Hey you okay? Come in. Without saying anything she moves to the couch and tries catch her breath. ZEKE (CONT’D) What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I miss you.  99.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Hol.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I know I screwed up with the whole Mo thing.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What whole Mo thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo walks out of the bathroom, shoving a wad of cash in hi pocket. On the other side of the party we see Epstein wea an elaborate Santa costume. He watches Mo. Mo tries one more time...

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Hey have you seen Sophie?

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM DUDE
dialogues.text: Who's Sophie?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eppy, stands in front of the house on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: EPPY
dialogues.text: Yes, Officer Peters? It’s Jonathan Epstein. The kid you are looking for is at 2253 Ridgeland. (hating what he is doing) Yes, I saw the drugs. We are tight on Epstein but can still make out the boomin party behind him. EPPY (CONT’D) Yes. His name is Monroe Kaufman. He hangs up the phone feeling embarrassed and pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo is about to leave the party when Sophie walks in.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Well I’m here. Are you leaving?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: No. Not anymore. He turns around and walks back in with her. INT. ZEKE’S CAR - SAME TIME Zeke is driving his car and stuffing his face with a cheeseburger and smoking a joint and singing along with Ashanti’s Foolish on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (to himself) My Mo?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Mo and Sophie are off in the corner watching drunk kids acting drunk and stupid. Mo is nervous, he keeps opening mouth to talk and then decides not to until...

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about the other night.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Zeke told me what happened.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I think I am realizing that Zeke may have no idea what he is talking about. It’s hard to hear him over the music.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: You want to go upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Um, yeah, sure. They leave the kitchen and walk up stairs into a bedroom We see Epstein dressed as Santa looking angry at the worl He watches them go upstairs, then chugs his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: What were you saying? Sophie sits down on the bed. ZEKE’S CAR —- SAME TIME Still driving, eating and singing. He slows down when he three police cars turn down a nearby subdivision. He look the street sign and instantly knows where they are going. throws the joint out the window, eats a breathmint, spray some freshener and makes a U-turn. As he turns onto the street he is stopped by one of the police cars. Their lights are off and they are forming a quiet barricade. An officer walks to his window.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sorry, this street is closed off.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Some house party got out of hand. Kids selling drugs.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (now very worried) Do you know who?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: We are going to need you to take another way home.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: It could just be somebody watching TV too loudly. You shouldn’t jump to conclusions.  102.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Either way sir you need to keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: This seems like a real waste of manpower for a little house party. People are getting shot up in the street for god sake.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sir are you saying you are aware of a shooting going on right now?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What? No? What? I’m just- this is my tax dollars at work man.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sir if you don’t-

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I’m going I’m going. Zeke pulls his car around the corner and parks it. He get out and starts running through backyards towards the big house at the end of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo is pacing back and forth in front of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Can we start over and have a first date so that we can have a first date where I didn’t pass out in front of you and my sister’s ex- boyfriend--

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: --but also not totally start over to before we kissed, because that was stressful enough and this time I‘1l just tell you how much I like you instead of taking Zeke’s advice to play it cool because let’s face it Zeke’s advice can only really get me as far as Zeke and is that how far I want to go, you know? I don’t know. I’m--  103.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: (interrupting his rant) How much do you like me? Mo snaps to attention.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I really like you.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: I like you too. You know I liked you before I met Zeke. I liked that you never tried to fit in.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Ya? He sits down on the bed next to her.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah I thought you were like some cool mysterious bad boy that played by his own rules.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Oh yeah, that’s totally me. Mister bad ass. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three cops burst through the front door. Forty Santas and slutty elves scream and run in every direction.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Nobody move. Where the hell is Monroe Kaufman. They look at a nearby coffee table where a bag of cocaine been left out.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: Don’t let anybody out.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Where is Monroe Kaufman?

dialogues.speaker: EPPY
dialogues.text: (pointing upstairs) He’s upstairs in that bedroom.  104.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: They stop kissing.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Did you hear my name?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Of course I heard your name the cops are screaming it. Mo jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I was really hoping that was in my head.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Zeke is almost there. He is trudging through the deep sno

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: A loud knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Monroe Kaufman are you in there? Open this door. This is the police.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: How do they know your name? Mo starts pacing around the room, not sure what to do. Shit shit shit shit shit.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Shit shit shit shit shit.  105.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: What is going on? Mo moves to the window at the opposite end of the room. I faces the backyard. He opens the window and looks down. T is a large patch of soft powdery snow, enough to cushion fall. He climbs out onto the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Mo looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: They’1l never take me alive.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: No, I’m kidding. They’1l totally take me alive. He kisses her then jumps out of the window. He falls through the soft powder...

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: ..-into the frozen over swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER WATER
dialogues.text: Mo is struggling. Trying to find a way out of the frozen pool. Everything goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE OF THE POOL
dialogues.text: Zeke gets to the backyard of the house and looks around frantically. He sees Sophie in the second floor window. S points to the pool.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER WATER
dialogues.text: Terrified, Mo closes his eyes and curls up in the fetal position. Zeke appears under the water swimming towards Mo. As Zeke pulls Mo to the surface, several twenty dollar bi fall out of his pockets and float around them.  106.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE OF THE POOL
dialogues.text: Zeke emerges, soaking wet with Mo, who is unconscious, th over his shoulder. The music swells. Zeke turns away from the house and runs with his friend i the woods. Zeke carries Mo deep into the snowy woods as fast as he c INT. EPSTEIN’S PARENTS MINIVAN - SAME TIME Epstein sits in the backseat looking out in the window as kids run in every direction from the house. He destroyed only thing he ever loved. A tear falls down his face as t busted up party fades into the white snowy darkness. INT. ZEKE’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM We push in on Zeke’s shower. He is fully dressed holding friend, trying to warm him up under the hot water. INT. ZEKE’S APARTMENT —- LIVING ROOM Mo comes out of the room, he is wearing new clothes that way too big on him and drying his hair with a towel. Zeke is sitting on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m so screwed. They know my name. They can find me. I can’t live here forever. It’s not big enough.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Did you sleep with Holly?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Oh fuck. No.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Mo.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I am so sorry. Zeke, you have to understand. It happened so fast and I had never- and she- and the towel- Wait why are we even talking about this? My life is over. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So can we just figure that out and then get back to whatever else is going on here.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Oh relax. You will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Easy for you to fucking say. You have literally never cared how this was going to end for me. (it sinks in) I need to run away, change my name or something. Oh shit...my parents. Mo collapses against the wall and starts to cry. Zeke is unsure what to do. He tries to remember if he has ever se Mo cry before and if he equipped to handle this.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Well I mean you don’t need to go kill yourself. Mo doesn’t answer. He just hyperventilates into his hands ZEKE (CONT’D) Okay ya know what, I thought about, and I forgive you for the Holly thing. Our friendship is stronger than that.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (through tears) I’m going to go to jail and end up like you.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Come on, man. You’re not going to end up like me.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Of course I am. Look at me, It’s already happened. I’m you.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: (genuinely curious) And that’s a bad thing?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (sobbing) It’s a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Sure.  108. He stares at his little distraught friend. ZEKE (CONT’D) Look, when the cops come, just tell them I did it, say I was bringing you the drugs and maybe you can make a deal or something, I dunno. Mo stops crying and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Fuck it. sure. Yeah, I mean. (pointing out his shitty apartment/life) What’s the worst they can do to me? Mo stands up.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Go home before I change my mind. Mo moves to the door. ZEKE (CONT’D) They would rather arrest a big fish like me anyway. Mo freezes, and turns on a dime, wiping away the last of tears. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m the biggest fuckin’ fish there is. Mo leaves, slamming the door behind him so hard that Zeke new painting falls off the wall and crashes to the floor. comes back in to survey the damage.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I’m glad you could stop crying long enough to make such a dramatic exit. That was a first edition Fujikawa print. Ass.  109.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Should I stay and help clean up or-

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are back where we started at the beginning. Mo is sitt in the back of the room spaced out. When the principal an Officer Peters walk into the room he knows exactly what i going on.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo is led down the hall in handcuffs, the sea of bodies t he was pushing his way through a few months earlier completely splits. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: EXT. PARK -— DAY Mo is wearing a neon orange vest over a winter coat. He i shoveling snow in a local park. Digging out the path as p of his court ordered community service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke sits in his car watching Mo and drinking hot coffee. After a while he honks the horn. Through the window we ca see Mo realize who it is. Zeke holds up the hot coffee. M drops the shovel and walks over.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I'm freezing my balls off.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You'll get used to it.  110.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: What did you bring me? Zeke pulls out a PB and J sandwich and splits off half fo his friend.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Are you done over there?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Yeah but now I gotta go do the thing.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Again?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: They called my number. (off Zeke’s annoyed look) What do you want from me? I lost my license. I can’t drive myself. I’m sure they would give it back to me if I turned you in. It might not even be too late for that. Who knows, I could be wearing a wire right now. Zeke grumbles something under his breath and turns the ca on.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (british accent) Let’s go driver. Show me the meaning of haste.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: This is some bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman sitting at the receptionist desk greets Mo with a smile. The waiting room is filled with some real grimey looking halfway-house type dudes. Zeke follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Just go sit over there. I’ll be a minute.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Hi Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Hey Rhonda.  111. He goes up to her desk and signs in on a little clipboard then sits down next to Zeke.

dialogues.speaker: MO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gotta go by the grocery store after this. Soph needs some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Are you sure I’m not third wheeling with you guys tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? Sophie loves you. She personally asked me to bring you.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Did you ever tell her about you and Holly?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Ya know it hasn’t come up.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: So she thinks that-

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: She was my first, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Wow good for Holly. Not only did she take your virginity. She is also the first girl you and I have ever both shared.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: First and last.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know man, you should see the way Sophie looks at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo pees into the cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the cup of urine in the cabinet.  112.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I’m feeling really good about this batch.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: See you on Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (To a passed out addict) Hang in there José. Zeke follows him out.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys walk down an aisle. Mo pushes the cart and reads from the list.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (reading) Raw Catfish nuggets.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Shut up, it doesn’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Yes it does.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I’m not figuring out what that is, just bring her fish sticks. Zeke opens the fridge and grabs a box of fish sticks.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (ignoring that) Well, I’11 tell you, I did not think it was going to end like this.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Everything is sort of fine.  113.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yeah man. What did you think, you were going to end up dead ina ditch somewhere? You sold some pot. Nobody got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Well...some people got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yeah but that would have happened with or without you. The sun doesn’t rise and set just for you.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: No. I just- I don’t know. I just feel the same. Like I am the same person I was last year. I just go to a different school.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You have a girlfriend. You are getting laid regularly.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: I do like that.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What’s next? Let’s get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: (reading) Pickled Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Oh look there’s Doug. On the other end of the aisle Doug walks towards them.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Ya know. That guy’s not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: Look at you all grown up and mature.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I think I’m going to talk to him about giving me a job.  114. Doug socks Zeke in the face. Bringing him quickly to the ground. He starts punching him over and over. Mo is too stunned to intervene, he just watches as this guy savagel beats the shit out of Zeke.

dialogues.speaker: MO
dialogues.text: That’s how I thought this would end. CUT TO BLACK.
